111.content:
Early the next morning, Sakura Haruno fiddled with the back of her dress akwardly. "Why do I have to ruin this perfect figure of mine for a stupid exam?" the kunoichi lamented as she managed to zip up the garment.

A package lay at the foot of her bed, it was a box with a pair of cherry colored sweatpants and a plain white t-shirt in varying sizes. She scoffed at the idea of wearing something so slovenly. "I'm not wearing that!" she huffed, "I may have to get fat, but I know for a fact that Sasuke likes girls with long hair and look good!" Of course, this was only the recent gossip about Sasuke Uchiha, Konoha's official babe-magnet

The pink haired ninja bounded down the stairs, "Bye Mom, I'm meeting Naruto and Sasuke at Ichiraku's!" her mother merely smiled, "Bye Sakura, and would you mind asking Mrs. Yamanaka how Ino liked those dumplings?"

But Sakura was already out the door, enjoying her lithe frame for as long as it lasted...

Naruto Uzumaki sat at the booth, "Hey Mr. Chef!" he ordered, "Another bowl of Miso Pork please!"

The elderly man nodded to his daughter and she began to get to work. "So what's up kid?" he leaned in towards the young ninja, "You've been hitting the ramen pretty hard lately, even for you."

"I gotta gain weight for the Chunnin Exams." Naruto bluntly stated. He had been at Ichiraku's Ramen Shop all morning stuffing his kraut, and all he got was a stomachache! "Gee... I don't know how Chouji puts up with this all the time..." he sighed

"You know kid, you've practically grown up on our ramen, and you never gained a pound," Teuchi got the order from Ayame and placed it in front of his best customer, "And far be it from me to drive away business, but I think you should start hitting up other places than just binging at our quaint little shop!"

Before Naruto could mull this over, Sakura's familiar shriek blasted his eardrums, "Naruto?! Are you wearing those ridiculous sweatpants?!" Naruto looked over and sure enough, Sakura was not far behind from her yelling.

"Yeah, aren't they cool?!" Naruto grinned as he faced his teammate, "So stretchy!"

Sakura looked at the village idiot, his sweatpants were orange and blue where her's were red and white. "Probably custom made..." Sakura thought inwardly. Naruto's shirt was slathered in broth, leaving unsightly yellow and brown stains all over it's white fabric. "How come you're not wearing yours?" Naruto offered a seat to his pink haired object of affection

"Of course not!" she corrected, "They're dorky and uncool!"

"When you put it that way," a nonchalant voice came from down the street, "they sound like a perfect fit for you both if you ask me." It was Sasuke, of course. Where Sakura wasn't wearing her sweatpants or shirt, and Naruto was wearing his, Sasuke had altered his out fit to fit his style.

The Uchiha ninja stood proudly adorned in a black t-shirt with his clan's symbol on the back. His sweatpants were blue and white, but he had cut them off at the knees and wore his arm warmers. Sakura swooned, "Even dressed like a slob, Sasuke is sooo adorable!"

"Hey Sasuke, what's up?" Naruto managed through a mouthful of noodles. "Hi Sasuke!" Sakura squealed. Sasuke snorted, "Chef!" the young ninja sat down at the barstool, "One order of plain ramen and a friend egg." Teuchi smiled, "Comin' up kid!"

Sakura joined her teammates, "So you're both really taking this gaining thing seriously, huh?" Naruto was the first to answer as usual, "Of course, if it'll get me to being Hokage faster then I don't care what it is!" she turned to Sasuke, hoping to hear something cool and dramatic. "Meh, I could always lose the weight later."

Teuchi placed in front of each of the boys, "Order up boys, enjoy!" Sakura watched as her friends at their ramen, Naruto slurping his down like a pig and Sasuke approaching it calmly yet quickly. The chef turned to Sakura, "And you, little lady?"

Sakura pointed a slender finger at herself, "Who? Me?" Teuchi grinned, "Yeah! You're on the same team, right?"

The pink haired girl thought for a second, "Erm... one Chicken Dumpling Ramen please!"

Bowls piled up on the counter, villagers stared at the three gorging kids, and the occassional belch from Naruto was heard through the slurping.

After an hour or so, Naruto finally stopped. He rose to his feet, his stomach was gurgling in pain. "Oh man!" he massaged his poor stomach, "This hurts!" Sasuke smirked, "Loser." Everyone laughed as the blonde boy massaged his swollen stomach. "It's not funny!"

Naruto continued treating his stomachache for another half an hour before Sasuke and Sakura each threw in the towel. Sakura looked at her bowl pile:

Five bowls. She remembered that number. If she was ever going to get better, she was going to have to get past five bowls of ramen. She looked at Naruto's pile, 15 and even Sasuke's pile was 10! Sakura was shocked! She never knew Sasuke could eat that much!

Naruto sloshed a full belly, "Ah... nothing like a good ramen feast to get the training going!"

"We're trying to gain weight, Naruto." Sakura corrected, "No training, remember?"

Naruto squinted his slanted eyes, "...Oh yeah!"

Sakura wobbled back into her room. She was stuffed! Stuffed to the gills! Her dress tightened around her broth-and-noodle-filled stomach constrictingly. A whole day dedicated to eating, Damn Naruto and his stupid appetite! She sighed deeply, remembering the box she inched her way over to the edge of the bed.

She picked out a pair of pants from the bottom and unfolded them. They were so big! Sakura could fit into these three times over! "How big does Kakashi Sensei expect us to get?" she asked. Her stomach gurgled, Sakura had to admit though, the feeling of a full belly felt good...

She sighed, "I guess I could always lose the weight after the chunnin exams... and Naruto could always stay fat!" she laughed

As his vision gradually refocused, he saw the familiar characters of his favorite ramen joint scrawled in ink on a sign posted on the pole. Quickly scanning the lines, Naruto loudly concluded, "Awww alright, they're having a big sale! All you can eat!"

Naruto produced a small, wrinkled white slip of paper from one of hispockets, "And I've got the lucky coupon that'll let me in for ramen half off tonight!"

The eager genin pictured himself slurping up ramen by lamplight on a warm, peaceful nights. The empty dishes stacked up to the stars. As he slipped out of his daydreams, Naruto licked his lips in anticipation.

Just then, he put two and two together, "Hey now... I can eat as much as I want because of that new event in the Chunin exams. Kakashi-sensei won't care at all if I completely pig out and put on weight. In fact... that's what I'm supposed to be doing so I can show up Sasuke!"

Naruto bunched up, doing his hearty little giggle before thrusting a fist in the air, "Yeah, I'm going to totally one up Sasuke! He may act cool and play games with chakra, but now he's in my turf. I love ramen, and eating is MY mainstay... plus, nobody's gonna scold me for letting myself go all out. Hehehe... We'll see who'll come out on top."

Just then, a loud crash sounded to Naruto's side. As he spun around, he saw a crochety old man speed out of an ancient looking shop with a rickshaw full of books and scrolls. Dust burst out from out of the shop's dilapidated curtains and into the streets. The old man was cackling wildly until his own dust caught up with him, forcing him to halt his dash, instead violently coughing in a not quite stationary position.

Naruto caught up with the wirey haired fellow, helping him up, "Are you okay?"

The senior's eyes bulged wildly at the blond haired ninja before bursting into laughter, "Okay? This is the happiest day I've ever had in fifty-two years! Hahaha! Katashi's been hoarding up his books for decades, and FINALLY that old crone's gone out of business! Aha! I've made off with a killing, a killing! So far I've picked more rare books and scrolls than I can carry- with no more money than it would take to buy lunch, mind you!"

Naruto wrinkled his nose, "Meh, what's to do with some dusty old scrolls, anyhow?"

The old man forced his face just an inch from Naruto's before knocking him in the forehead hard, "Say, what kind of shinobi are you, anyhow? Don't you know that these scrolls contain the works of art in not only literature and poetry from over the course of hundreds of years, but the arts of NINJUTSU as well?" he barked.

"Oh yeeeahhh..." Naruto blurted, having forgotten, "But still, you're old and crochety, what are you going to do with ninjutsu?"

The old man scowled and spat at the boy, "Bah, respect your elders, you little brat. While I might not be as sprawling and flexible as I used to be, I can analyze these 'dusty old scrolls', as you put it, and write a book of my own to make a killing! Now, if you'll excuse me..." he said, straightening up his rickshaw, "I have to dump these off at my estate before I come back for the second load... urgh..." he moaned, pulling it up, "... I'll... go back and forth... taking as much as I can... why not take a look at what's in there, boy... urgh, you might learn a thing or two... you might run across an unheard of but useful jutsu you need in your training... because after today, mark my words, this place is going to the birds! Haha... the birds!" he crowed as he rolled off to the distance.

A jutsu that I need... Naruto blinked. Hey, if this guy's been hoarding up books for so long, then maybe I can find something even Kakashi will have never heard of to help me stack on weight. That could be my secret weapon against Sasuke...

But if I want to take advantage of the sale at the ramen store, I really should show up early... even if there's not a huge crowd, I will get to eat more that way.

Well, Naruto, he thought to himself, looks like you need to make a choice...

"I'll take that as a yes." Baki insisted. "What?!? *sigh* fine." Temari had no choice. "Kankuro, what about you?" Kankuro sat up. "Well, If it'll make Temari feel better, I'll do it." "Good. Garra?" Garra stood silent, he was thinking. "love no one....love no one but yourself......kill......kill to SURVIVE!!!" Garra came back to his physical self. "When do we start?"
